nodes.documentation: @notice Stop pool routine operations
nodes.name: stop

nodes.documentation: @notice Resume pool routine operations
nodes.name: resume

nodes.documentation:
@notice Stops accepting new Ether to the protocol
      * @dev While accepting new Ether is stopped, calls to the `submit` function,
as well as to the default payable function, will revert.
      * Emits `StakingPaused` event.
nodes.name: pauseStaking

nodes.documentation:
@notice Resumes accepting new Ether to the protocol (if `pauseStaking` was called previously)
NB: Staking could be rate-limited by imposing a limit on the stake amount
at each moment in time, see `setStakingLimit()` and `removeStakingLimit()`
      * @dev Preserves staking limit if it was set previously
      * Emits `StakingResumed` event
nodes.name: resumeStaking

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets the staking rate limit
      * @dev Reverts if:
- `_maxStakeLimit` == 0
- `_maxStakeLimit` >= 2^96
- `_maxStakeLimit` < `_stakeLimitIncreasePerBlock`
- `_maxStakeLimit` / `_stakeLimitIncreasePerBlock` >= 2^32 (only if `_stakeLimitIncreasePerBlock` != 0)
      * Emits `StakingLimitSet` event
      * @param _maxStakeLimit max stake limit value
@param _stakeLimitIncreasePerBlock stake limit increase per single block
nodes.name: setStakingLimit

nodes.documentation:
@notice Removes the staking rate limit
      * Emits `StakingLimitRemoved` event
nodes.name: removeStakingLimit

nodes.documentation: @notice Check staking state: whether it's paused or not
nodes.name: isStakingPaused
getCurrentStakeLimit
getStakeLimitFullInfo
setProtocolContracts
setFee
setFeeDistribution

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns staking rewards fee rate
nodes.name: getFee

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns fee distribution proportion
nodes.name: getFeeDistribution
receiveELRewards

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets limit on amount of ETH to withdraw from execution layer rewards vault per LidoOracle report
@param _limitPoints limit in basis points to amount of ETH to withdraw per LidoOracle report
nodes.name: setELRewardsWithdrawalLimit
setWithdrawalCredentials

nodes.documentation: @notice Returns current credentials to withdraw ETH on ETH 2.0 side after the phase 2 is launched
nodes.name: getWithdrawalCredentials

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets the address of LidoExecutionLayerRewardsVault contract
@param _executionLayerRewardsVault Execution layer rewards vault contract address
nodes.name: setELRewardsVault
handleOracleReport

nodes.documentation:
@notice Adds eth to the pool
@return StETH Amount of StETH generated
nodes.name: submit

nodes.documentation: @notice Gets the amount of Ether controlled by the system
nodes.name: getTotalPooledEther

nodes.documentation: @notice Gets the amount of Ether temporary buffered on this contract balance
nodes.name: getBufferedEther
getBeaconStat

nodes.documentation:
@title Liquid staking pool
  * For the high-level description of the pool operation please refer to the paper.
Pool manages withdrawal keys and fees. It receives ether submitted by users on the ETH 1 side
and stakes it via the deposit_contract.sol contract. It doesn't hold ether on it's balance,
only a small portion (buffer) of it.
It also mints new tokens for rewards generated at the ETH 2.0 side.
  * At the moment withdrawals are not possible in the beacon chain and there's no workaround.
Pool will be upgraded to an actual implementation when withdrawals are enabled
(Phase 1.5 or 2 of Eth2 launch, likely late 2022 or 2023).
nodes.name: ILido
